verses.kjv: Remember, O LORD, what is come upon us: consider, and behold our reproach.
verses.web: Remember, LORD, what has come on us. Look, and see our reproach.
verses.ct: LORD, remember what has happened to us. Look at us and see our disgrace.

verses.kjv: Our inheritance is turned to strangers, our houses to aliens.
verses.web: Our inheritance has been turned over to strangers, our houses to aliens.
verses.ct: Our land has been handed over to strangers, and foreigners live in our homes.

verses.kjv: We are orphans and fatherless, our mothers are as widows.
verses.web: We are orphans and fatherless. Our mothers are as widows.
verses.ct: We are orphans without fathers. Our mothers are like widows.

verses.kjv: We have drunken our water for money; our wood is sold unto us.
verses.web: We have drunken our water for money. Our wood is sold to us.
verses.ct: We have to pay money for our own water. Even our firewood comes at a price.

verses.kjv: Our necks are under persecution: we labour, and have no rest.
verses.web: Our pursuers are on our necks. We are weary, and have no rest.
verses.ct: Our enemies are right on our heels. We are exhausted and get no rest.

verses.kjv: We have given the hand to the Egyptians, and to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
verses.web: We have given our hands to the Egyptians, and to the Assyrians, to be satisfied with bread.
verses.ct: We surrendered to Egypt and Assyria just to get enough bread to survive.

verses.kjv: Our fathers have sinned, and are not; and we have borne their iniquities.
verses.web: Our fathers sinned, and are no more. We have borne their iniquities.
verses.ct: Our fathers sinned, and now they are gone — but we are the ones carrying the weight of their guilt.

verses.kjv: Servants have ruled over us: there is none that doth deliver us out of their hand.
verses.web: Servants rule over us. There is no one to deliver us out of their hand.
verses.ct: Slaves rule over us now, and there is no one to rescue us from their grip.

verses.kjv: We gat our bread with the peril of our lives because of the sword of the wilderness.
verses.web: We get our bread at the peril of our lives, because of the sword of the wilderness.
verses.ct: We risk our lives just to get food, facing the sword of raiders in the wilderness.

verses.kjv: Our skin was black like an oven because of the terrible famine.
verses.web: Our skin is black like an oven, because of the burning heat of famine.
verses.ct: Our skin burns like an oven from the fever of starvation.

verses.kjv: They ravished the women in Zion, and the maids in the cities of Judah.
verses.web: They ravished the women in Zion, the virgins in the cities of Judah.
verses.ct: They violated the women in Zion and the young girls throughout the cities of Judah.

verses.kjv: Princes are hanged up by their hand: the faces of elders were not honoured.
verses.web: Princes were hanged up by their hands. The faces of elders were not honored.
verses.ct: Princes were hung up by their hands. Elders were shown no respect.

verses.kjv: They took the young men to grind, and the children fell under the wood.
verses.web: The young men carry millstones. The children stumbled under loads of wood.
verses.ct: Young men were forced to grind at millstones, and children staggered under heavy loads of wood.

verses.kjv: The elders have ceased from the gate, the young men from their musick.
verses.web: The elders have ceased from the gate, and the young men from their music.
verses.ct: The elders no longer sit at the city gate, and the young men have stopped playing their music.

verses.kjv: The joy of our heart is ceased; our dance is turned into mourning.
verses.web: The joy of our heart has ceased. Our dance is turned into mourning.
verses.ct: All joy has drained from our hearts. Our dancing has turned to mourning.

verses.kjv: The crown is fallen from our head: woe unto us, that we have sinned!
verses.web: The crown has fallen from our head. Woe to us, for we have sinned!
verses.ct: The crown has fallen from our head. How terrible for us — we have sinned!

verses.kjv: For this our heart is faint; for these things our eyes are dim.
verses.web: For this our heart is faint. For these things our eyes are dim.
verses.ct: Because of all this, our hearts are sick. Because of these things, our eyes have grown dim with tears.

verses.kjv: Because of the mountain of Zion, which is desolate, the foxes walk upon it.
verses.web: For the mountain of Zion, which is desolate. The foxes walk on it.
verses.ct: Mount Zion lies in ruins, so desolate that jackals roam freely across it.

verses.kjv: Thou, O LORD, remainest for ever; thy throne from generation to generation.
verses.web: You, LORD, remain forever. Your throne is from generation to generation.
verses.ct: But you, LORD, reign forever. Your throne endures from generation to generation.

verses.kjv: Wherefore dost thou forget us for ever, and forsake us so long time?
verses.web: Why do you forget us forever, and forsake us for so long a time?
verses.ct: Why have you forgotten us completely? Why have you abandoned us for so long?

verses.kjv: Turn thou us unto thee, O LORD, and we shall be turned; renew our days as of old.
verses.web: Turn us to yourself, LORD, and we will be turned. Renew our days as of old.
verses.ct: Bring us back to yourself, LORD, and we will return. Restore our lives to what they once were.

verses.kjv: But thou hast utterly rejected us; thou art very wroth against us.
verses.web: But you have utterly rejected us. You are very angry against us.
verses.ct: Unless you have rejected us entirely — unless your anger against us knows no end.
